basics.name: Garrick Aden-Buie
basics.label: Data Scientist/Educator
basics.summary: Motivated, life-long learner. Always looking for questions and answers in the data. Passionate about collaboration, sharing knowledge, and communicating insights. Known as a highly organized, perceptive, and resourceful team player.

work.company: Collaborative Data Services (CDS), Moffitt Cancer Center
work.summary: Worked closely with CDS analysts and Moffitt investigators as a software engineer to design and implement approachable and consistent tools to automate data access, cleaning, and reporting. Provided training and support to CDS analysts in data science best practices while architecting and implementing new workflows.
highlights: Designed and led trainings in R programming, data analysis, and version control for multiple teams at Moffitt
Developed **moffittverse**: a set of inter-related R packages for access to heterogeneous hospital data systems, with an API intentionally designed for broad accessibility
Led a weekly educational session for dozens of Moffitt R users centered around _R for Data Science_

work.summary: Created and led an entirely new, two-day, hands-on and project-driven workshop for 90 Shiny users on JavaScript and web development at one of the largest conferences for R users. Developed the js4shiny R package to support the workshop and provide additional resources and tools for JavaScript development in R and RStudio using R Markdown and Shiny, including an R Markdown format for literate JavaScript programming and a Codepen clone for RStudio with live preview of HTML, CSS and JS.

work.company: Gerke Lab, Cancer Epidemiology, Moffitt Cancer Center
work.summary: Conducted advanced bioinformatic and statistical analyses in support of cancer epidemiology research. Developed several R packages and worked with diverse data systems architects to coordinate development efforts throughout the data life cycle. Applied novel analytic approaches and software pipelines to multiplex immunohistochemistry data.
highlights: Designed and developed a Shiny dashboard interface with companion R package for analysis of the FCDS Florida Cancer Registry data
Created and led an in-depth course on data processing with R for data analysts in CDS
Co-PI: Internal $50,000 grant to develop DV3, a framework for data virtualization, visualization and versioning

work.summary: Led diverse team of Ph.D., masters and undergraduate students in development and evaluation of large smart home project for monitoring the daily activities of community-dwelling, independent older adults.
highlights: Managed 3 Ph.D., 5 Masters, and 4 undergraduate REU students
Lead software developer for remote sensor data collection, processing, storage, admin, and visualization
Developed several R packages and Shiny applications for inventory management and data processing

work.summary: Developed an R package for Multiple-Choice Test Analysis for educators who are not comfortable programming. The package includes a web interface for interactive exploration of test results, or a generated report based on best practices for the design and evaluation of multiple-choice tests.
Served in the Peace Corps in Gualaceo, Ecuador, working in conjunction with local organizations to provide leadership training to children and youth among a number of other highlights listed below.
highlights: Created and implemented life-skills training program, educating 70 at-risk middle school students.
Led Peace Corps Ecuador’s Anti-Trafficking In Persons committee and created contest-based fundraiser for a shelter for trafficked women in Guayaquil, Ecuador.

Various educational activities including: establishing a tutoring program for math students; designing interactive materials for children and parents around topics of public health; developing and delivering drug and alcohol abuse prevention education for parents.
Started a student-led monthly journal club to share and disseminate cutting-edge publications in statistics, machine learning, and operations research.
Organized and led a college-wide code and data bootcamp for undergraduate and graduate students, featuring hands-on learning of data science and programming principles.

education.institution: Universidad Autónoma de Madrid and Syracuse University in Madrid

awards.title: Runner Up, Shiny App Contest
awards.summary: Selected as one of 10 developers from 136 submissions in recognition of a web app and dashboard built using Shiny. The dashboard monitors social media conversations around a conference or event, and received hundreds of simultaneous visitors per day during RStudio's annual conference in January 2019.

projects.name: Scientific Software
highlights: moffittverse - An collection of internal R packages for data access and analysis at Moffitt. Enables and facilitates database access and workflows using various hospital data systems.

fcds — [gerkelab.github.io/fcds](https://gerkelab.github.io/fcds)
An R package and Shiny web application for the analysis of Florida Cancer Regististry data from the [Florida Cancer Data System](https://fcds.med.miami.edu/inc/welcome.shtml)

ShinyDAG — [gerkelab.com/project/shinydag](https://gerkelab.com/project/shinydag)
A web application for building, analyzing, and visualizing directed acyclic graphs (DAGs)

projects.name: Open Source Software
projects.summary: I enjoy contributing to open source software projects and whenever possible I contribute to the R packages that I use. I also have released the following software packages for R on CRAN and GitHub:
